result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Christopher Patrick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $250.00 payable to Viktorya B.; and $1,000.00 payable to West Bend Mutual. Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first during probation and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges and supervision fees or civil judgment will be entered with tax intercept.
All court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and tax intercept or other means.

superMiscConds.notes:
No drugs or alcohol.
Do not frequent places where alcohol or illegal drugs are sold, distributed or used.
No firearms, weapons.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
No firearms; weapons.

records.addlTxt: Filed, signed Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment.  The Court Orders the petition for sentence adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Cynthia Davis, Branch 21, calendar successor, for review. mag
Defendant's Petition for Sentence Adjustment.  (Michael C. Patrick - #436886, Oakhill Correctional Institution - C-3, PO Box 938, Oregon WI 53575).

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to DRUG ABUSE CORRECTIONAL CENTER ATTN. STEPHANIE P..O BOX 36 . WINNEBAGO, WI 54985-0036

IT IS ORDERED

that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this Order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by DOC Records Office staff and will be based upon actual release date. 

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED

that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release within SIX (6) working days upon receipt of this Order.

IN ALL OTHER RESPECTS THE ORIGINAL JUDGMENT HEREIN IS AFFIRMED.

Signed and filed, sdg.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 33 Judge Ashley
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt:
Certification of SENTENCING transcript commencing 06-24-2016 received and filed. (19 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Other.

Defendant Michael Christopher Patrick in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  Defendant Michael Christopher Patrick in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of FOUR (4) YEARS, with credit for TWO HUNDRED AND NINETEEN (219) DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is TWO (2) YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is TWO (2) YEARS.  The defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol. 
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.
* DO NOT frequent places where alcohol or illegal drugs are sold, distributed or used.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Restitution payable to VIKTORYA B for TWO HUNDRED AND FIFTY DOLLARS ($250.00) or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first during probation and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.
* Restitution payable to WEST BEND MUTUTAL for ONE THOUSAND DOLLARS ($1,000.00) or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first during probation and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered with tax intercept.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and tax intercept or other means.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Defendant Michael Christopher Patrick in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Michael Christopher Patrick in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months to 18 months.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Case transferred to br 6 for drug treatment court admissions on 6/17/2015 at 1:30pm.  lms
